Query: How to delete history of last 10 commands in shell?

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_20935918: delete last character of filenames in a folder

so_20935918: | sh

for i in *.txt; do echo "mv '$i' '${i/?.txt}.txt'"; done | sh

Answers.MP Summary: output the last part of files
Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_232453: how to delete a header without deleting other rows in linux?

Explanations about Options.-n:
output the last NUM lines, instead of the last 10; or use -n +NUM to output
 starting with line NUM

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_144298: Delete the last character of a string using string manipulation in shell script
ul_576922: How to delete the record based on last character of previous record in a file
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_576922: $ awk '(prev !~ /"$/) || ($1 ~ /^"/){print} {prev=$1}' file
abcd|efg
"xyz"|"ghi"
"lmn"|"qrs"

$ awk '!( (prev ~ /"$/) && ($1 !~ /^"/) ){print} {prev=$1}' file
abcd|efg
"xyz"|"ghi"
"lmn"|"qrs"

$ awk '{f=((prev ~ /"$/) && ($1 !~ /^"/)); prev=$1} !f' file
abcd|efg
"xyz"|"ghi"
"lmn"|"qrs"

Answers.MP Summary: output the first part of files

print the first NUM lines instead of the first 10; with the leading '-', print all
